Documentation.Description: This is a generic timeout error
Documentation.Message: An operation timed out
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: BMC code had a generic internal failure
Documentation.Message: An application had an internal failure
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: BMC code was given an invalid argument
Documentation.Message: Code was given an invalid argument
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: An operation failed due to insufficient permission
Documentation.Message: An operation failed due to unsufficient permission
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: An operation failed because it isn't allowed
Documentation.Message: An operation failed because it isn't allowed
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: The server's CA certificate has not been provided
Documentation.Message: The server's CA certificate has not been provided

Documentation.Description: Sensor device read failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when reading a sensor device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH.

Documentation.Description: Device read failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when reading a hardware device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH.

Documentation.Description: Device write failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when writing to a hardware device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH

Documentation.Description: Device write failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when writing to a hardware device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH

Documentation.Description: Failed to write to a file
Documentation.Message: Failed to write to a file
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: Certificate verification failed
Documentation.Message: Certificate verification failed

Documentation.Description: Failed to open a file
Documentation.Message: Failed to open a file
Notes: The file name is in a UserData section.

Documentation.Description: Failed to read a file
Documentation.Message: Failed to read a file
Notes: The file name is in a UserData section.

Documentation.Description: Failed to seek in a file
Documentation.Message: Failed to seek in a file
Notes: The file name is in a UserData section.

Documentation.Description: The BMC sent the host a malformed PEL
Documentation.Message: The BMC sent the host a malformed PEL
Notes: The host firmware rejected that PEL.

6.Description: The PLID of the invalid PEL

7.Description: The corresponding OpenBMC event log ID

8.Description: The size of the invalid PEL

Documentation.Description: The host sent the BMC an invalid PEL
Documentation.Message: The host sent the BMC an invalid PEL

Documentation.Description: An error for testing
Documentation.Message: This is a test error

Documentation.Description: This entry is used when no other matching entry is found
Documentation.Message: Unknown (Original event not in message registry)
Notes: This is used when the actual error name isn't found in
the registry.  The original error name will be stored
in the UserData section that contains the AdditionalData
properties using the key ERROR_NAME.
This error may contain callouts if the creator passed
them in.
The severity is set by the creator.
If this error is seen, then a code change needs to be
made to add the missing error entry to this registry.

Documentation.Description: An error for testing
Documentation.Message: This is a test recoverable error
Notes: This error is not created by BMC code and is
only used for error injection tests.

Documentation.Description: This is an error used for testing only
Documentation.Message: This is a test predictive error
Notes: This error is not created by BMC code and is
only used for error injection tests.

Documentation.Description: All event logs were deleted
Documentation.Message: All event logs were deleted
Notes: This is an informational error noting that
someone deleted all of the event logs.

Documentation.Description: Failure occurred during boot process
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred during boot process
Notes: Debug traces will be captured in AdditionalData section

Documentation.Description: Failure occurred during PHAL pre-poweroff operations
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred during PHAL pre-poweroff operations
Notes: Severity needs to be set based on needs for this registry.
FFDC (First Failure Data Collection) will be collected
and added into PEL.

Documentation.Description: Failure occurred during PHAL devtree sync
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred during PHAL devtree sync
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: Failure occurred during PHAL devtree backup
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred during PHAL devtree backup
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: Host did not respond to BMC after a BMC reset
Documentation.Message: Host did not respond to BMC after a BMC reset but hardware indicates it is running
Notes: System will be left in its current state to ensure host
is not unexpectedly taken down. There is most likely an
issue in the software or hardware communication path
between the BMC and the Host firmware.
A BMC dump will be collected with relevant FFDC.

Documentation.Description: Failure re-initializing BMC to Host data structure
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred during re-initializing BMC to Host data structure
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: Non functional boot processor
Documentation.Message: Non functional boot processor
Notes: BMC firmware couldn't find functional primary processor
required to boot the host
Debug traces will be captured in AdditionalData section

Documentation.Description: Error during memory preserving reboot
Documentation.Message: Error during memory preserving reboot
Notes: Software error occured during memory preserving reboot

Documentation.Description: Error during Spare clock initialisation
Documentation.Message: Error during Spare clock initialisation
Notes: The clock symbolic FRU in the CalloutList provides the
reference to clock unit.

Documentation.Description: Informational error to house clock debug info
Documentation.Message: Informational error to house clock debug info
Notes: User data includes processor and clock register state information.

Documentation.Description: Guard partition access failure
Documentation.Message: Guard partition access failure
Notes: User data and journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: There was a failure while initializing the FSI links
Documentation.Message: There was a failure while initializing the FSI links
Notes: The FSI device driver had a problem doing a scan.
The callouts are done based on the passed in FSI device path.

Documentation.Description: OCC presence mismatch
Documentation.Message: BMC firmware detected incorrect number of OCCs
Notes: The number of OCCs detected by the BMC does not match the number of OCCs detected by the OCC.
The BMC requests that the OCC reset.

Documentation.Description: OCC safe state
Documentation.Message: OCC in safe state while active for one minute
Notes: The BMC detected that the OCC was in safe state for one minute while active.
The BMC requests that the OCC reset.

Documentation.Description: OCC communication failure
Documentation.Message: BMC failed to communicate with the OCC
Notes: The BMC failed to communicate with the OCC and retried three times.
The BMC requests that the OCC reset.

Documentation.Description: OCC communication failure
Documentation.Message: BMC failed to communicate with the OCC
Notes: There was a failure trying to open an OCC device driver file

Documentation.Description: OCC PDR records not found
Documentation.Message: BMC firmware was not able to find the OCC sensor ID records
Notes: The OCC sensor ID records for the OCCs were not found which will prevent the BMC from
communicating with the OCCs. Firmware will continue to try searching for the records.

Documentation.Description: Failure occurred during hardware isolation operations
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred during hardware isolation operations
Notes: Severity needs to be set based on needs for this registry.
Debug traces will be captured in AdditionalData section

Documentation.Description: Failure to read chassis poweron time from persistent file
Documentation.Message: Failure to read chassis poweron time from persistent file
Notes: Severity needs to be set based on needs for this registry.
Debug traces will be captured in AdditionalData section

Documentation.Description: Failure to write chassis poweron time to persistent file
Documentation.Message: Failure to write chassis poweron time to persistent file
Notes: Severity needs to be set based on needs for this registry.
Debug traces will be captured in AdditionalData section

6.Description: Number of system guard records if any

8.Description: Number of PEL's having deconfig bit set

Documentation.Description: Firmware detected either a FRU deconfigured And/Or guard record
Documentation.Message: Firmware detected either a FRU deconfigured And/Or guard record
Notes: Either Guard And/Or Deconfiguration records found during periodic check
as part of the NAG event. Look into the BMC Nag dump for more details.
This is a reminder for servicing faulty hardware pending service present
in the system.

Documentation.Description: Host was booting or booted before BMC reset but is now unresponsive
Documentation.Message: Host did not respond to BMC after a BMC reset but it was booting or booted prior to the BMC reboot
Notes: System will follow recovery policy, resulting in this
error and most likely a a reboot of the host. The issue
is most likely the result of the BMC rebooting while the
host was booting and in a state where it still needed
the BMC to complete its boot.

Documentation.Description: Chassis input power is in a bad state
Documentation.Message: Chassis input power is in a bad state, look for other logs with more details
Notes: The system is most likely in a limited power situation.
There is enough power for the BMC to operate but not the
CEC hardware. Check for UPS or brownout logs.

Documentation.Description: User initiated a pinhole reset via the op-panel
Documentation.Message: User initiated a pinhole reset via the op-panel
Notes: This is a notification log to record the fact that a
pinhole reset was performed on the BMC, resulting in a
hard reset of the BMC.

Documentation.Description: A critical BMC application has failed on the system
Documentation.Message: A critical BMC application has failed on the system, the BMC is in an undefined state
Notes: As a part of generating this error log, a BMC dump has
also been generated. Please collect this dump if possible.
The BMC state is undefined but basic services could still
be available. Usually an AC cycle of the entire system is
the best recovery option from this error.

Documentation.Description: A firmware security check has failed
Documentation.Message: A firmware security check has failed, most likely something is not configured correctly
Notes: This log is only generated in the manufacturing
environment and it indicates that something has not
been configured correctly. Use the data in the PEL to
determine what that is.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to reach BMC Ready state
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to reach BMC Ready state, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
for the BMC to reach Ready state has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to reach chassis power on state
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to reach chassis power on state, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
for the BMC to power on the chassis has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to reach chassis power off state
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to reach chassis power off state, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
for the BMC to power off the chassis has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to start the host firmware
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to start the host firmware, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
for the BMC to start the host has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to start the host firmware
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to start the host firmware, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
for the BMC to start the host has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to shutdown the host firmware
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to shutdown the host firmware, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
to shutdown the host firmware has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to stop the host firmware
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to stop the host firmware, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
to stop the host firmware has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The system has failed to reboot the host firmware
Documentation.Message: The system has failed to reboot the host firmware, look for other errors
Notes: This log indicates a critical BMC application required
to reboot the host firmware has failed to start
successfully. Look in the log for other errors indicating
what has failed.

Documentation.Description: The host firmware has failed to boot
Documentation.Message: The host firmware has failed to boot and has entered a Quiesce state. Look for other errors.
Notes: This log indicates that the host firmware has failed to
boot and all retries have been exhausted. There should be
other logs with more details on the boot failure reason.

Documentation.Description: TPM measurement failed
Documentation.Message: The system has detected a failure in the TPM measurement.
Notes: This error occurs when /sys/class/tpm/tpm0/pcr-sha256/0
is missing or has a value of 0, indicating a potential compromise
of the system's boot process.
Please contact your system administrator or next level support
to investigate and resolve the issue.

Documentation.Description: A power on of the chassis has been started
Documentation.Message: The chassis is powering on.
Notes: This informational error is logged each time the chassis
is powered on.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: chipop failure with SBE provided FFDC
Documentation.Message: chipop request failure reported by SBE
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Callouts added based on SBE provided FFDC.
SBE provided additional debug data included as part of the
additional user data section.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: SBE chipop timeout
Documentation.Message: chipop timeout reported during SBE communication
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Check SBE Dump associated to this error to debug the failure.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: The SBE on this processor is not in a state where chipOps can be issued
Documentation.Message: SBE Chipop is not allowed due to invalid SBE state
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.

Documentation.Description: Boot failure with SBE provided FFDC
Documentation.Message: Boot failure reported by SBE
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Callouts added based on SBE provided FFDC.
SBE provided additional debug data included as part of the
additional user data section.

Documentation.Description: SBE Boot timeout
Documentation.Message: timeout reported during SBE boot process
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Check SBE Dump associated to this error to debug the failure.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: SBE internal FFDC data after SBE chipop success
Documentation.Message: SBE internal FFDC data after SBE chipop success
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Callouts added based on OCMB SBE provided FFDC.
OCMB SBE provided additional debug data included as part of
the additional user data section.

Documentation.Description: Status shows TI special attention active
Documentation.Message: TI special attention detected
Notes: This entry is for any TI special attention event
reported by the attention handler component

Documentation.Description: The attention handler encountered an error
Documentation.Message: Attention handler error %1
Notes: Attention handler will provide error code

Documentation.Description: Status shows SBE vital attention active
Documentation.Message: SBE vital attention detected
Notes: This entry is for any SBE vital attention event
reported by the attention handler component

Documentation.Description: A system checkstop attention has occurred
Documentation.Message: Error Signature: %1 %2 %3

Documentation.Description: A hardware attention requiring service has occurred
Documentation.Message: Error Signature: %1 %2 %3

Documentation.Description: Manual analysis was initiated via the command line. FFDC only.
Documentation.Message: Error Signature: %1 %2 %3

Documentation.Description: Power Supply input power fault
Documentation.Message: A power supply has indicated an input or under voltage condition.
Notes: Check the power supply cabling and/or input power
source. The PWRSPLY procedure is used rather than
calling out a location code, as typically these faults
are related to the supplied power, the cable, or the
cable connectors. If the input fault resolves down to an
issue with the power supply itself, the power supply
indicating this input fault should be called out. Add the
CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH to the additional data, and set the
CALLOUT_PRIORITY to something other than high.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply power fault
Documentation.Message: The power supply detected a fault condition, see AdditionalData for further details.
Notes: The power supply reporting the fault should be called
out using the CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH keyword. Include
specific fault, STATUS_* details, and code level in the
AdditionalData section.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply non-power fault
Documentation.Message: A communication failure occurred talking to the power supply
Notes: Communication problems with the power supply could be
the power supply, or any hardware between it and the
BMC. Reporting the error should be passing in a call
out using CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply is missing
Documentation.Message: A power supply that should be present is missing
Notes: The CalloutList should use the PWRSPLY symbolic FRU
with the trusted location code property.  The
location code in this callout is obtained from
the passed in CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH value.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply configuration is not supported
Documentation.Message: The power supply configuration is not supported
Notes: The combination of power supplies detected in the
system is not supported. This could be caused by
mismatched models, less than expected number of power
supplies, or other unsupported characteristics.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply firmware update successful
Documentation.Message: Successful PSU code update
Notes: Successful PSU firmware update, verify current firmware level
in the PEL detail data

Documentation.Description: Power Supply firmware update failed
Documentation.Message: Unsuccessful PSU code update
Notes: This message may indicate failure triggered due to multiple reasons,
an issue with I2C transactions, an I2C exception, or a failure in the
firmware download procedure. Some of the callout severity is set dynamically
by the application based on the failure. Detailed information in the PEL
journal data for further debugging.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply firmware missing
Documentation.Message: Unsuccessful PSU code update
Notes: This PEL can be triggered by a missing firmware path, empty firmware
file, or failure to open. Possible causes in the image firmware
path. Detailed information in the PEL journal data.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply fan fault
Documentation.Message: A power supply indicated a fan fault has occurred
Notes: The power supply reporting the fault should be called
out using the CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH keyword. Include
specific fault, STATUS_* details, and code level in the
AdditionalData section.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply output over-current power fault
Documentation.Message: A power supply has indicated an output over-current condition.

Documentation.Description: Input power was lost while the system was powered on.
Documentation.Message: Input power was lost while the system was powered on.
Notes: Input power was lost while system powered on.
The CalloutList should use the ACMODUL symbolic FRU.

Documentation.Description: A power supply fault is potentially preventing the power supply from allowing the system to power on.
Documentation.Message: Power supply PSKill_fault

Documentation.Description: A power off was issued because a power fault was detected
Documentation.Message: A power off was issued because a power fault was detected

Documentation.Description: A power off was issued because a regulator for standby power faulted
Documentation.Message: A power off was issued because a regulator for standby power faulted

Documentation.Description: The power sequencer chip detected a PGOOD fault
Documentation.Message: The power sequencer chip detected a PGOOD fault

Documentation.Description: The power sequencer chip detected a voltage fault
Documentation.Message: The power sequencer chip detected a voltage fault

Documentation.Description: Voltage regulator phase fault detected; device now at redundancy level N (no redundant phases)
Documentation.Message: Voltage regulator phase fault detected; device now at redundancy level N (no redundant phases)
Notes: CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH should be specified in the
AdditionalData property of the event log so that
the device is called out but not the communication path.

Documentation.Description: Voltage regulator phase fault detected; device now at redundancy level N+1 (one redundant phase)
Documentation.Message: Voltage regulator phase fault detected; device now at redundancy level N+1 (one redundant phase)
Notes: CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH should be specified in the
AdditionalData property of the event log so that
the device is called out but not the communication path.

Documentation.Description: A write verification error occurred on a device
Documentation.Message: A write verification error occurred on a device
Notes: This error occurs when a device register is written,
read back, and the two values do not match.  This is
also called a read-back error.  The device should be
identified using the CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH or
CALLOUT_IIC_BUS/CALLOUT_IIC_ADDR keywords in the
AdditionalData property of the event log.  This will
cause the device and the hardware in the communication
path to be called out.

Documentation.Description: The Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) battery is discharging and providing power to the system due to a utility failure
Documentation.Message: The Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) battery is discharging and providing power to the system due to a utility failure

Documentation.Description: The Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) battery level is low
Documentation.Message: The Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) battery level is low

Documentation.Description: A regulators configuration file error occurred
Documentation.Message: A regulators configuration file error occurred
Notes: The regulators configuration file could not be found,
could not be read, or had invalid contents.

Documentation.Description: A critical regulators configuration file error occurred
Documentation.Message: A critical regulators configuration file error occurred
Notes: The regulators configuration file could not be found,
could not be read, or had invalid contents.  As a result
voltage regulators could not be configured, and the
chassis could not be powered on.

Documentation.Description: The power sequencer chip detected a fault
Documentation.Message: The power sequencer chip detected a fault

Documentation.Description: System power failed to turn on within timeout period
Documentation.Message: System power failed to turn on within timeout period

Documentation.Description: System power failed to turn off within timeout period
Documentation.Message: System power failed to turn off within timeout period

Documentation.Description: An internal firmware error occurred
Documentation.Message: An internal firmware error occurred
Notes: The error details must be provided in the AdditionalData
property of the event log.

Documentation.Description: An I2C error occurred communicating with a device
Documentation.Message: An I2C error occurred communicating with a device
Notes: The device should be identified using the
CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH or CALLOUT_IIC_BUS/CALLOUT_IIC_ADDR
keywords in the AdditionalData property of the event
log.  This will cause the device and the hardware in the
communication path to be called out.

Documentation.Description: A PMBus error occurred on a device
Documentation.Message: A PMBus error occurred on a device
Notes: This error occurs when the I2C communication was
successful, but the PMBus value read is invalid or
unsupported.  CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH should be specified
in the AdditionalData property of the event log so that
the device is called out but not the communication path.

Documentation.Description: A firmware inter-process communication (D-Bus) error occurred
Documentation.Message: A firmware inter-process communication (D-Bus) error occurred

Documentation.Description: Fan rotor fault
Documentation.Message: Fan rotor fault
Notes: This error occurs when a fan rotor has been faulted for a
certain amount of time.  The callout is the fan which is
passed in with CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH.  The severity is
passed in during creation and will be either informational
or unrecoverable.  The action flags use the defaults and
vary based on the severity.

Documentation.Description: A fan is missing
Documentation.Message: A fan is missing
Notes: This error occurs when a fan has been missing for a
certain amount of time.  The first callout is the
symbolic FRU AIR_MOVR that has the trusted fan location
code, which it gets using the passed in
CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH.  The second callout is the FRU
where the controller and GPIO expander are.

Documentation.Description: Presence detect methods for the same fan disagree
Documentation.Message: Presence detect methods for the same fan disagree
Notes: This error occurs when there is more than one way to detect
fan presence, and they don't all agree.  For example, the
GPIO says a fan isn't present, but the tach readings are
nonzero.  This is informational, unless in manufacturing.
The fan FRU is passed in as a high priority callout.
The FRU the GPIO source is on is called out medium.

Documentation.Description: The fan controller device is offline
Documentation.Message: The fan controller is offline.  The system must be powered off.
Notes: The device that controls the fans is offline so the fan
targets and speeds are unknown.  The system will be shut
down to preserve thermal safety.  There may be an I2C
or power problem with the device.

Documentation.Description: Fan GPIO sensors not present
Documentation.Message: Fan GPIO sensors not present
Notes: The device that reports fan presence is not functioning.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor exceeded its performance loss threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor exceeded its performance loss threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed its performance loss threshold value
If it is the ambient sensor, then a symbolic FRU will be added.
Otherwise, CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH will be passed in to add
a FRU callout.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is under its performance loss threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is under its performance loss threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed under its performance loss threshold value
If it is the ambient sensor, then a symbolic FRU will be added.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor exceeded its warning threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor exceeded its warning threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed its warning threshold value
If it is the ambient sensor, then a symbolic FRU will be added.
Otherwise, CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH will be passed in to add
a FRU callout.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is under its warning threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is under its warning threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed under its warning threshold value
If it is the ambient sensor, then a symbolic FRU will be added.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor exceeded its critical threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor exceeded its critical threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed its critical threshold value
If it is the ambient sensor, then a symbolic FRU will be added.
Otherwise, CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH will be passed in to add
a FRU callout.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is under its critical threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is under its critical threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed under its critical threshold value
If it is the ambient sensor, then a symbolic FRU will be added.

Documentation.Description: The ambient temperature passed the EPOW3 limit.
Documentation.Message: The ambient temperature passed the EPOW3 limit. The system will shut down if temp doesn't decrease.
Notes: This error occurs when the ambient temperature surpassed
the EPOW3 shutdown limit.

Documentation.Description: The ambient temperature is back under the EPOW3 limit.
Documentation.Message: The ambient temperature is back under the EPOW3 limit.

Documentation.Description: The ambient temperature passed the EPOW4 limit.
Documentation.Message: The ambient temperature passed the EPOW4 limit. The system will shut down
Notes: This error occurs when the ambient temperature surpassed
the EPOW4 shutdown limit.

Documentation.Description: An altitude sensor exceeded its warning threshold.
Documentation.Message: An altitude sensor exceeded its warning threshold.
Notes: The virtual altitude sensor crossed its warning threshold value
and a symbolic FRU will be added.

Documentation.Description: An altitude sensor is under its warning threshold.
Documentation.Message: An altitude sensor is under its warning threshold.
Notes: The virtual altitude sensor is under its warning threshold value
and a symbolic FRU will be added.

Documentation.Description: A voltage sensor went below its critical low threshold.
Documentation.Message: A voltage sensor went below its critical low threshold.

Documentation.Description: A voltage sensor is over its critical low threshold.
Documentation.Message: A voltage sensor is over its critical low threshold.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is under its low warning threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is under its low warning threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed its low warning threshold value
CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH will be passed in to add a FRU callout.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is above its low warning threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is above its low warning threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed above its low warning threshold value.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is under its low critical threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is under its low critical threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed its low critical threshold value
CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH will be passed in to add a FRU callout.

Documentation.Description: A temperature sensor is over its low critical threshold.
Documentation.Message: A temperature sensor is over its low critical threshold.
Notes: A temperature sensor crossed above its critical threshold value

Documentation.Description: A path access error occurred
Documentation.Message: An EEPROM path access error occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when parser is unable to access
EEPROM path. Errno and device path are captured as
additional data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid VPD data.
Documentation.Message: A VPD data exception occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when VPD data is found to be
invalid. This can be when VPD file is missing out
mandatory records.Inventory path is captured in
additional data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid VPD ecc data.
Documentation.Message: A VPD ecc exception occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when VPD ecc check fails for the FRU.
Inventory path for the failed FRU is captured in additonal
data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid Json
Documentation.Message: A Json failure occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when parser fails to access
Json file or there is any issue with Json data.
Failed Json path and cause of failure is captured
in additional data.

Documentation.Description: Default value found on VPD.
Documentation.Message: Found default VPD.
Notes: This error occurs when a default value found on VPD.
Details regarding failure are captured in additional data.

Documentation.Description: Dbus exception
Documentation.Message: A Dbus internal error occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when Dbus operation fails.
Exceptions details are captured in additonal
data.

Documentation.Description: Unknown System Type
Documentation.Message: System type not supported in DTB table.
Notes: System type comes from combination of HW and IM value of system VPD.
If anything gets changed in that combination, then it can't determine
the appropriate DTB for that system. Need to check HW and IM keywords.

Documentation.Description: GPIO line error
Documentation.Message: GPIO line couldn't be found or read.
Notes: The BMC could not access a GPIO line. This can be a hardware issue
or driver issue. Since a hardware or a software issue cannot be
differentiated, the BMC code will be called out.

Documentation.Description: VPD mismatch found between primary and backup
Documentation.Message: Error occurred due to VPD mismatch between primary and backup.
Notes: This error occurs when there is a data mismatch between
primary and backup VPD.
Details regarding the failure are captured in additional data.

Documentation.Description: Essential FRU check.
Documentation.Message: Essential FRU check failed
Notes: This error occurs when VPD manager service detects any
missing essential FRU. These are FRUs which are required
to be present in the system at the time of power on.
The inventory path is captured in additional data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid system configuration found
Documentation.Message: Found Invalid system configuration.
Notes: This error occurs when there is a mismatch between the IM value
saved on the planar Hardware and the eBMC cache. This scenario
should never occur, PE intervention is required to cross check
and correct the IM value as needed.

Documentation.Description: Unable to determine the correct system configuration
Documentation.Message: Found un-configurable system configuration.
Notes: This error occurs when there is a mismatch between the IM value
saved on the planar Hardware and the eBMC cache.
PE intervention is required to cross check and correct values as
needed, PE needs to verify the Processor FRU number and take a
decision as to what IM needs to be set to boot the system
successfully.

Documentation.Description: Firmware error.
Documentation.Message: A std runtime failure occurred in VPD Manager code.
Notes: This error occurs when a std runtime exception
is thrown in the VPD Manager code for errors which
can't be categorised in any specific category.
Cause of failure is captured in additional data.

Documentation.Description: VPD parsing error.
Documentation.Message: An error occurred while parsing VPD file
Notes: This error occurs when VPD parsing fails for either data or ECC
errors for different records for a single EEPROM file. User data
will capture the actual reason for parse failure.

Documentation.Description: Button Handler Failure
Documentation.Message: Input Device path failure
Notes: Button events will not be processed.

Documentation.Description: Panel I2C setup failure
Documentation.Message: Unable to open device path or ioctl failure
Notes: The Panel is unable to open device
path or ioctl failure

Documentation.Description: Host Communication failure
Documentation.Message: Error in sending message to host
Notes: Failure from PLDM sending message to
Host

Documentation.Description: Dbus exception
Documentation.Message: A Dbus internal error occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when Dbus operation fails.
Exceptions details are captured in additional
data.

Documentation.Description: LCD/Bootfail PIC code update failure.
Documentation.Message: Error while doing LCD/bootfail PIC code update.
Notes: Panel firmware(LCD/bootfail PIC) update fails due to
unsupportable firmware version. Inventory path to the
FRU on which PIC controller is physically present will
be called out.

Documentation.Description: Host did not respond within the watchdog timeout interval
Documentation.Message: Host did not respond before the watchdog timeout interval expired
Notes: Host did not respond before the expiry of the watchdog timeout interval.
Collecting hostboot dump.

Documentation.Description: BMC rebooted unexpectedly due to kernel panic
Documentation.Message: BMC rebooted unexpectedly resulting in a ramoops dump being collected
Notes: Investigate the collected BMC dump to identify the reason for the BMC reboot.

Documentation.Description: A system component has a software version that is incompatible.
Documentation.Message: A system component has a software version that is incompatible.

Documentation.Description: This image version already exists on the device.
Documentation.Message: This image version already exists on the device.

Documentation.Description: An error occurred during untar.
Documentation.Message: An error occurred during untar.

Documentation.Description: An error occurred when reading the software image Manifest file.
Documentation.Message: An error occurred when reading the software image Manifest file.

Documentation.Description: The operation failed internally during processing the image.
Documentation.Message: The operation failed internally during processing the image.

Documentation.Description: An error occurred processing the image.
Documentation.Message: An error occurred processing the image.

Documentation.Description: The device is busy during the update.
Documentation.Message: The device is busy during the update.

Documentation.Description: The Update Access Key has expired.
Documentation.Message: The Update Access Key has expired.

Documentation.Description: The software image has an invalid signature.
Documentation.Message: The software image has an invalid signature

6.Description: Size of the current running partition

7.Description: Size of the read only partition

Documentation.Description: Corrupted or changed preserved file
Documentation.Message: Partition was not preserved on reboot
Notes: This error may occur if one of the partitions marked
PRESERVED is either corrupted, or a change of size is
desired for a particular partition.

Documentation.Description: A BMC factory reset has been requested
Documentation.Message: A BMC factory reset has been requested

Documentation.Description: An audit event of type Integrity was recorded
Documentation.Message: An audit event of type Integrity was recorded
Notes: The Linux Integrity Measurement Architecture (IMA) on the
BMC has detected a potential integrity violation, such as
the attempt to execute an unsigned binary. Refer to the
User Data section for details.

Documentation.Description: Failed to get the requested dump object path.
Documentation.Message: Failed to get the requested dump object path from the system.

Documentation.Description: Failed to make a new dump notify request to the dump manager application.
Documentation.Message: Failed to make a new dump notify request to the dump manager application.

Documentation.Description: Failed to get the dump offload URI path from the dump entry.
Documentation.Message: Failed to get the dump offload URI path from the dump entry.

Documentation.Description: The hypervisor rejected the request to initiate a new resource dump.
Documentation.Message: The hypervisor rejected the request to initiate a new resource dump.

Documentation.Description: Failed to reset the dump ID, due to this requested dump will not be deleted.
Documentation.Message: Failed to reset the dump ID, due to this requested dump will not be deleted.

Documentation.Description: Failed to carry out the dump delete request from the hypervisor.
Documentation.Message: Failed to carry out the dump delete request from the hypervisor.

Documentation.Description: Failed to set the dump offloaded completion flag in the dump entry.
Documentation.Message: Failed to set the dump offloaded completion flag in the dump entry.

Documentation.Description: Failed to get the file path for the BMC dump and offload to the hypervisor.
Documentation.Message: Failed to get the file path for the BMC dump and offload to the hypervisor.

Documentation.Description: Failed to get the file path for the BMC dump and offload to the hypervisor.
Documentation.Message: Failed to get the file path for the BMC dump and offload to the hypervisor.

Documentation.Description: Could not create a new resource dump due to hypervisor verification failed.
Documentation.Message: Could not create a new resource dump due to hypervisor verification failed.

Documentation.Description: Failed to set the dump offload completion flag in the dump entry details.
Documentation.Message: Failed to set the dump offload completion flag in the dump entry details.

Documentation.Description: Failed to notify a new dump available request.
Documentation.Message: Failed to notify a new dump available request.

Documentation.Description: Failed to send the resource dump parameters for a new dump initiation.
Documentation.Message: Failed to send the resource dump parameters for a new dump initiation.

Documentation.Description: Failed to send the certificate/license file to the host.
Documentation.Message: Failed to send the certificate/license file to the host.

Documentation.Description: Failed to decode the response of certificate/license file sent to the host.
Documentation.Message: Failed to decode the response of certificate/license file sent to the host.

Documentation.Description: Failed to send the new certificate/license file to the host.
Documentation.Message: Failed to send the new certificate/license file to the host.

Documentation.Description: Failed to set state effecter states.
Documentation.Message: Failed to set state effecter states.

Documentation.Description: Failed to parse PDR JSON file.
Documentation.Message: Failed to parse PDR JSON file.

Documentation.Description: Failed to get state sensor PDR state.
Documentation.Message: Failed to get state sensor PDR state.

Documentation.Description: Failed to encode state sensor request.
Documentation.Message: Failed to encode state sensor request.

Documentation.Description: Failed to subscribe for concurrent maintenance of FRU.
Documentation.Message: Failed to subscribe for concurrent maintenance of FRU.

Documentation.Description: Host did not send a surveillance ping within stipulated timeout interval.
Documentation.Message: Host did not send a surveillance ping within stipulated timeout interval.

Documentation.Description: Failed to reset the dump offload URI path from the dump entry.
Documentation.Message: Failed to reset the dump offload URI path from the dump entry.

Documentation.Description: Host failed to complete the power off gracefully within the timeout.
Documentation.Message: Host failed to complete the power off gracefully within the timeout.

Documentation.Description: Dump has been deleted
Documentation.Message: BMC/System/Resource dump has been deleted

Documentation.Description: Failed to collect PDR from Host within the timeout of BMC PDR Exchange.
Documentation.Message: Failed to collect PDR from Host within the timeout of BMC PDR Exchange.

Documentation.Description: Failed to send NewFileAvailable request to remote terminus.
Documentation.Message: Failed to send NewFileAvailable request to remote terminus.

Documentation.Description: Failed to decode NewFileAvailable response
Documentation.Message: Failed to decode NewFileAvailable response

Documentation.Description: Dump has been offloaded
Documentation.Message: BMC/System/Resource dump has been offloaded

Documentation.Description: A BMC failover has been started
Documentation.Message: A BMC failover has been started
Notes: The requester is in plain text in a UserData section.

Documentation.Description: A request to start a failover was blocked
Documentation.Message: A request to start a failover was blocked
Notes: A UserData section shows the requester and the reason
for the block in plain text.  The severity will be
Informational if the request came from rbmctool, otherwise
it will be Predictive.

Documentation.Description: Redundancy has been manually disabled
Documentation.Message: Redundancy has been manually disabled
Notes: Someone manually disabled redundancy.

Documentation.Description: The BMC claimed the passive role due to an error
Documentation.Message: The BMC claimed the passive role due to an error
Notes: Due to an error the BMC cannot be active and must be passive.
Even if the other BMC is active, redundancy cannot be enabled.
Check the UserData for the role reason in plain text.

Documentation.Description: BMC redundancy cannot be enabled
Documentation.Message: BMC redundancy cannot be enabled
Notes: The UserData will have plain text descriptions of the reason(s)
why redundancy can't be enabled.

Documentation.Description: Correctable ECC memory error collection limit is reached.
Documentation.Message: Correctable ECC memory error collection limit is reached.

Documentation.Description: Correctable ECC/other correctable memory error.
Documentation.Message: Correctable ECC/other correctable memory error.

Documentation.Description: Uncorrectable ECC/other uncorrectable memory error.
Documentation.Message: Uncorrectable ECC/other uncorrectable memory error.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: chipop failure with OCMB SBE provided FFDC
Documentation.Message: chipop request failure reported by OCMB SBE
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Callouts added based on OCMB SBE provided FFDC.
OCMB SBE provided additional debug data included as part of the
additional user data section.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: OCMB SBE chipop timeout
Documentation.Message: OCMB chipop timeout reported during SBE communication
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Check OCMB SBE Dump associated to this error to debug the failure.

6.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class, [24:31] command type

Documentation.Description: SBE internal FFDC data after SBE chipop success
Documentation.Message: SBE internal FFDC data after SBE chipop success
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
Callouts added based on OCMB SBE provided FFDC.
OCMB SBE provided additional debug data included as part of
the additional user data section.

Documentation.Description: A failure of the issued sync has occurred
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred while syncing the data in a path in data sync
Notes: The severity is set by the creator
Traces of Data Sync and stunnel is captured

Documentation.Description: This is used when there is an error associated with setting up sync events
Documentation.Message: Failure to create watcher or set the sync event for a path
Notes: The severity is set by the creator
Traces of Data Sync is captured

Documentation.Description: This is used when there is an error associated with parsing configuration
Documentation.Message: Unable to parse the datasync JSON configuration file as expected
Notes: The severity is set by the creator
Traces of Data Sync is captured

Documentation.Description: This is an error log associated with Notify Requests and Services provided by data sync
Documentation.Message: Failure occurred in the Notification service/request after the data was synced
Notes: The severity is set by the creator
Traces of Data Sync and stunnel is captured
